titleStmt.title: Loring, Ellis Gray (per F.L?S.), letter, Boston, August 30, 1854, to Peter Still, with postscript signed by Frederic L? Seymour

msContents.p: Correspondence (1850-1875), chiefly relating to Still's campaign to purchase his wife, Vina Still, and family held as slaves in Alabama and the publication (1856) of Kate E.R. Pickard's biography, The Kidnapped and the Ransomed; memo book (1853-1854) of funds collected; and Still family record (1798-1821). Persons and places represented include William Lloyd Garrison, Horace Greeley, Harriet Beecher Stowe, and Cortlandt Van Rensselaer, and Burlington, N.J., and Philadelphia, Pa. 57 items.

Abbreviations and spellings have been maintained within the transcriptions, and the full word and corrected or modern spellings have been provided. Words or phrases that are deemed indecipherable have been noted as "unclear."

div.p:
I acknowledge the receipt of a letter
from Rev. A. L. Brooks, enclosing a cheque
of the Pequonnock Bank of Bridgport, Conn.
on the Granite Bank of Boston, for three
hundred dollars, dated Aug. 29, 1854, and
have placed said amount to your credit, on
my books, as directed.

ab.add:
When your write again, Mr. Still, I should
be interested to know what is the prospect
of getting your family out of Slavery; what
you now expect to have to pay, &c.
Very sincerely,
Frederic L. Seymour
